content: As many posters have asked, what does it take for these banking scoundrels, who allegedly have fiduciary responsibility for their customers' money, to get jail time for theft. Steal a loaf of bread, go to jail. Steal A LOT of bread, pay a fine and still make out just fine. Like Woody Guthrie sang in "Pretty Boy Floyd", a song about a small time 1930s bank robber..."As through this life you ramble, you'll meet some funny men. Some rob you with a six-gun, some with a fountain pen."
